panels.description: The amount of time that the instance has been running.
panels.title: Engine Uptime

panels.description: The percentage of CPU used by an Aurora MySQL DB instance.
panels.title: CPU Utilization

panels.description: The average number of queries executed per second.
panels.title: Current QPS

panels.description: The amount of available random access memory, in bytes.
panels.title: FreeableMemory

panels.content: Amazon provides 1 million CloudWatch API requests each month at no additional charge. Past this, it costs $0.01 per 1,000 requests. This dashboard does 15 requests on each refresh.

panels.description: The percentage of CPU used by an Aurora MySQL DB instance.
panels.title: CPU Utilization

panels.description:
`CPUCreditBalance /  Credits Accumulated ` - 
The number of CPU credits that an instance has accumulated. This metric applies only to db.t2.small and db.t2.medium instances. It's used to determine how long an Aurora MySQL DB instance can burst beyond its baseline performance level at a given rate.

`CPUCreditUsage / Credits Consumed` - 
The number of CPU credits consumed during the specified period. This metric applies only to db.t2.small and db.t2.medium instances. It identifies the amount of time during which physical CPUs have been used for processing instructions by virtual CPUs allocated to the Aurora MySQL DB instance.
panels.title: CPU Credit Usage

panels.description:
`NetworkReceiveThroughput` - 
The amount of network throughput received from clients by each instance in the Aurora MySQL DB cluster, in bytes per second. This throughput doesn't include network traffic between instances in the Aurora MySQL DB cluster and the cluster volume.

`NetworkThroughput` - 
The amount of network throughput both received from and transmitted to clients by each instance in the Aurora MySQL DB cluster, in bytes per second. This throughput doesn't include network traffic between instances in the DB cluster and the cluster volume.
panels.title: Network Traffic

panels.description: The amount of available random access memory, in bytes.
panels.title: Memory

panels.description:
`ActiveTransactions` - 
The average number of current transactions executing on an Aurora MySQL DB instance per second.

`BlockedTransactions` - 
The average number of transactions in the database that are blocked per second.
panels.title: Active / Blocked Transactions

panels.description: The number of connections to an Aurora MySQL DB instance.
panels.title: Database Connections

panels.description:
`Aurora Replica Lag` - 
For an Aurora MySQL Replica, the amount of lag when replicating updates from the primary instance, in milliseconds.

`AuroraBinlogReplicaLag` - 
The amount of time an Aurora MySQL DB cluster lags behind the source DB cluster.

This metric reports the value of the Seconds_Behind_Master field of the MySQL SHOW SLAVE STATUS command and is useful for monitoring replica lag between Aurora DB clusters that are replicating across different AWS regions.

links.title: Replicating Amazon Aurora MySQL DB Clusters Across AWS Regions.

panels.title: Replication Statistics

panels.description:
`DMLThroughput` - 
The average number of inserts, updates, and deletes per second.

`DDLThroughput` - 
The average number of DDL requests per second.
panels.title: DML / DDL Throughput

panels.description:
`ReadIOPS` - 
The average number of disk I/O operations per second.

`WriteIOPS` - 
The average number of disk I/O operations per second.
panels.title: Disk Operations

panels.description:
`ReadLatency` - 
The average amount of time taken per disk I/O operation.

`WriteLatency`  - 
The average amount of time taken per disk I/O operation.
panels.title: Disk Latency

panels.description: The number of outstanding read/write requests waiting to access the disk.
panels.title: Disk Queue Depth

panels.description:
`ReadThroughput` - 
The average number of bytes read from disk per second.

`WriteThroughput` - 
The average number of bytes written to disk per second.
panels.title: Disk Throughput

panels.description:
The amount of storage available for temporary tables and logs, in bytes.

Unlike for other DB engines, for Aurora MySQL this metric reports the amount of storage available to each DB instance for temporary tables and logs. This value depends on the DB instance class . 
You can increase the amount of free storage space for an instance by choosing a larger DB instance class for your instance.
panels.title: Storage Space

panels.description: The amount of swap space used on the Aurora DB instance.
panels.title: Swap Usage

panels.content:
# Setup

Add CloudWatch datasource to Grafana with the name `CloudWatch`.

Create IAM user and attach the managed policy `CloudWatchReadOnlyAccess`. Then put the credentials in the file `~grafana/.aws/credentials`:
```
[default]
aws_access_key_id = youraccesskeyid
aws_secret_access_key = yoursecretaccesskey
```
